meanings.sent1: She was unlevelling the table by removing one of its legs.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers were unlevelling the ground to build a new road.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was unlevelling the neatly stacked books on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The storm was unlevelling everything in its path, leaving chaos behind.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake unlevelling the entire city was a devastating sight.

meanings.definition: The act of making something not level.
meanings.sent1: The unlevelling of the floor caused the ball to roll in unexpected directions.
meanings.sent2: The unlevelling of the playing field led to an interesting game.
meanings.sent3: The unlevelling of the cake layers made it look like a delicious mess.
meanings.sent4: The unlevelling of power dynamics in the group created tension among members.
meanings.sent5: The unlevelling of the road surface made driving a bumpy experience.
